definition: Pompeii, ancient Roman town near Naples, Italy

sentences.english: It won't by easy against a new-look Pompey reckons Rick.
sentences.chinese: 裏克估計與面貌一新的龐貝較量將不會容易。

sentences.english: This season they made their worst start in 89 years of league football.
sentences.chinese: 本賽季龐貝的開局是球隊89年聯賽征戰史上最差的。

sentences.english: Pompey had cleared the Mediterranean of pirates, which is something that our governments can't seem to do.
sentences.chinese: 龐貝清除了地中海的海盜，這點我們政府似乎辦不到。

sentences.english: Next week we are flying to China, and going to Loulan, which is known as China's Pompeii in the desert.
sentences.chinese: 下週我們將飛去中國，去樓蘭這個中國沙漠中的龐貝。

sentences.english: Pompey was the Roman general who took over Jerusalem in 63 BCE.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬將領龐貝於公元前63年佔領了耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: Upon arrival, my uncle hugged Pompy and tried to give him courage.
sentences.chinese: 一來到我叔叔就擁抱了龐貝，想給他點勇氣。

sentences.english: To go to Pompeii today is to take a trip backward in time.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們到龐貝就是進行一次穿越時空的旅行。

sentences.english: Peristyle of the House of Vetti, Pompeii, Italy.
sentences.chinese: 義大利，龐貝，維提之家圓柱迴廊所環繞的中庭。
